_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP.TXT    
    LaSalle Farmers Grain Co.
    317 4 th street N.E.
    Madelia, Minn 56062
    Paul R Lange
    Agronomy Branch Mngr     UPDATE    2/2006

    RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY      (LA LP-Petro)  1000  0015  3059

    1.   The    LIQUID PROPANE    (L.P.)  Facility  Policy;

         -The owners, managemnet, operators and employees of  LaSalle Farmers Grain Company (LSFG)
    are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of LIQUID PROPANE.   If an accidental
    release should occur,   the facility and its employees are prepared to work   LASALLE VOL.   Fire Dept. 
    or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to the surrounding
    residents and environment.

    2.     Facility Information;        

         -The primary activity at the facility is the storage, transfer and Delivery of   LIQUID PROPANE         
    ( "LP" specifically for use as Corn Dryer Fuel)  ..as retail sales to Farmers.        

         -LIQUID PROPANE is received, stored, and distributed for /as a fuel for Corn Drying.        

         -The maximum quantity stored at this location could be :        
            156,000#   in a One  ( 1)  30,000 gal storage vessel    AND
            78,000#   in a One  ( 1)  18,000 gal storage vessel   

         -The maximum quantity handled would be the loading of 5000 gal Delivery Truck with a capacity        
             21000#   loading of a 5000 gal Delivery Truck.
            34000#   unloading of a 9500 gal Transport Truck 

    3.     The Worst-Case Release Scenerio and the Alternative Release Scenerio

            a.  The WORST-CASE release scenerio would be the release of the total contents of the storage
    tank released as a gas over 10 minutes.   The maximum quantity released would be 156000#  which
    represents the Total volume of the Largest storage tank at 85 percent of capacity as limited by design
    standards.   The distance to the  endpoint (Point of dispersion to 200 ppm) would be   .43  milesA?

            b.  The Alternative release scenerio based on the five-year accident history (or the most

likely
    potential incident) is a release from a rupture in a   2"  transfer pipe.   The distance to the  endpoint 
    (Point of dispersion to 1 %)   would be   .3  milesA?with the release of 75,800# of LIQUID PROPANE

    4.     The Accidential Release Prevention Program.

            LSFG  has REVEIWED  with its employees the provisions of   "EPA's  Risk Management Program 
    Guidance for Propane Storage Facilities"'  and the Maintanence of   Material Safety Data Sheets 



    5.     The Five-Year Accident History    

            a.  There have been   NO  accidental releases of LIQUID PROPANE  in the past  5 years that    

         -have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility;  nor
         -to  LSFG  's  knowledge, have resulted in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property
          damage, or environmental damage.

    6.     The Emergency Response Program / Plan    

           -The Facility has:    

            a.  A Written Emergency Action Plan,  In accordance with  OSHA  standard,   29  CFR  1910.38;    
    which is reviewed with employees,   the nature of the Plan /Program  and its contents,  is clearly,    
    to mitigate any Release... only to the extent of its employees and to utilize at every release or
    potential release Properly equipped Emergency Personnel.

            b.  Provide State and Local Authorities the Emergency Planning and Community  Right -To -Know
    information as required under  SARA  Title  III  (EPCRA)

            c.  A Written Emergency Response Program,     In accordance with  OSHA  standard   
    29   CFR   1910.120,   including Pre-Emergency Planning and Employee TrainingA?
    Which clearly instructs employee mitigatation, only with-in Capability,  and to rely and utilize 
    properly equipped and trained emergency personnel.

    7.     Planned Changes to Improve Safety

            Improvements to Safety is an  on-going process at  LSFG's facilities.  Periodic evaluations  
    are performed to access the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are  No additional

specific
    LIQUID PROPANE   safety recommendations for implementaion at this time.

                    Paul R Lange
                    Agronomy Branch Mngr
